intro: Viticella deltoidea, commonly known as the delta grapevine, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Vitaceae family, which includes grapes and other climbing plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring. It produces small, edible berries that are often used in local cuisine. Viticella deltoidea is typically found in rocky or coastal areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
